description: Ein kleiner Tradi für zwischendurch, leicht zu finden, abertrotzdem kein Drive-In. Der Cache führt Euch auf den Stinkesberg imNorden von Ratingen. Keine Sorge, die Nase wird hier höchstens zumSuchen des Caches benötigt, denn den Namen Stinkesberg(Steinchenberg) hat der Berg von den Findlingen, die am Osthang zufinden sind. Man sagt auch, dass dieser Berg einst eine Kultstättegewesen sei.Bevor der Orkan 'Kyrill' hier im Januar 2007 ganze Arbeitgeleistet hat, war dieser kleine Berg noch bewaldet. Seitdem hatman von hier aus einen schönen Blick auf die Kirchen Ratingens.Der Weg führt über gut befestigte Waldwege bis an den Rand desHügels. Nach Regenfällen kann der "Aufstieg" eventuell etwasrutschig und matschig sein. Die Cachedose bietet Platz für ein biszwei Coins, bitte einen Stift mitbringen.Viel Spaß wünscht PumpkinEater© PumpkinEater, Opencaching.de, CC BY-NC-ND, Stand: 07.05.2018;alle Logeinträge © jeweiliger Autor
name: Stinkesberg von PumpkinEater

weltengreif / 12.04.2015 / gefundenOh, finally, finally, I was getting to do that Mystery Madness trip to Lintorf, rake in all the question marks, and smile, smile, smile, as the sun smiled on me. I was so psyched when I got up at 6, got the bike ready and jumped into the car. I felt glorious.But it all went differently.As I got the bike out of the car at my parking spot some time around 7.30 something hit me with a bang: back home I'd wondered where my Allen key tool was but had decided I wouldn't need it today. Wrong: the saddle, still in its lowest position from my last trip, couldn't be readjusted without it. Fuck, I thought. But that wasn't going to stop me. The going would be slow and more arduous but sooner or later I'd meet a cyclist with an Allen key and would take care of that. Until then I'd have to make do with the saddle low as it was.But it all went differently.Some 2h later I indeed flagged down two cyclists but it wasn't in order to ask for an Allen key. The problem of the low saddle had, together with the rest of the bike, vanished while I was up on a hill to log an EC. When I'd got back down, the bike - simply dropped and, naive as I am, unlocked - was gone. My "Fuck!" this time was louder and longer. For a good 3/4h I searched about and stopped people, asking whether they had seen anyone... but of course to no avail. With my head hung low I slowly returned to the car. Once there however I decided to cut my losses and to the chase. The bike was gone, surely for good - why not then at least make the most of the day and log those caches on foot. With a sort of smile I got rolling.But things went differently.It was a cache later and I was already nearing the next one, where I saw a group of cachers just completing their log, that my smartie rang. Mellizard, the gf. "I'm afraid I've got bad news", she says. You too? I say. "I've locked myself out." Fffffffuuuuuuuuuuck!!!!!! That was the final straw. The gods were against me.And so I did the only sensible thing: tucked my tail in and ran, or drove, back home.Quick by-cache - but not quick enough :(TFTC!Cache #3817Edit:But it all went differently.The next day I was just about to head to Ratingen in order to report the bike stolen when I received a call from an unknown number. Puzzled I answered and suddenly I had a huge smile on my face. One of the two cyclists I'd stopped had chatted with a friend that evening, who told him about the bike he'd found out in the woods and, believing it stolen, had brought it to the police. And so, when the police officer said she hoped I didn't want to file charges as well (I think they were already busy with one) I smiled and said I had meant to originally but I had got lucky and was just here to fetch my bike.Oh, sweet! To be returned my bike and likewise my faith in humanity!This entry was edited by weltengreif on Monday, 13 April 2015 at 21:23:18 UTC.
PumpkinEater / 08.02.2015 / kann gesucht werdenWeiter geht's.

mic@ / 20.06.2014 / momentan nicht verfügbarBitte bei Statusänderungen, die bei geocaching.com durchgeführt werden, auch immer hier den Status ändern.Gemäß GC1R882 setze ich den Status für diesen Cache jetzt  auf "Momentan nicht verfügbar".Sobald der Cache wieder gesucht werden kann, kann dies durch den Owner selbstständig wieder geändert werden.Bei Unklarheiten oder Fragen kannst du gerne mich oder das Team kontaktieren.mic@ (OC-Support)
